intro: Pilosella arvicola subsp. pseudocollina, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a perennial herb with a low-growing, cushion-like habit, adapted to cold and harsh alpine environments. The plant features dense, hairy stems and basal leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom in early summer. Pilosella arvicola subsp. pseudocollina is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
